summary: Email correspondence between legal teams discussing scheduling interviews with two new clients (victims) of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss allegations of abuse occurring between 2002-2012 in multiple locations and trafficking to other men. The timing is considered in light of a superseding indictment.

persons.name: Mariann Wang
persons.context: Attorney from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP who is reaching out to schedule meetings for two new clients (victims) to provide information about abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and trafficking to other men.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney cc'd on the email correspondence regarding scheduling meetings for Epstein victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the perpetrator of abuse against the two clients described in the email. His 'world' and conduct are subjects of the proposed witness interviews.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in coordinating victim interviews for the Epstein investigation, as indicated by being on the same email chain.
Wang is representing clients who are victims of Epstein, making her legally opposed to him in the context of the investigation.

events.title: Proposed victim interview date
events.description: A proposed date (March 17, 2021, at 3 PM EST) for interviews with two new Epstein victims, to be conducted by the legal/investigative team.

events.title: Abuse period for Client 2
events.description: One of the periods during which Client 2 reports being abused by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Abuse period for Client 1
events.description: The period during which Client 1 reports being abused by Jeffrey Epstein, including while he was in jail.

events.title: Second abuse period for Client 2
events.description: A second, later period during which Client 2 reports being abused by Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Two new clients (victims) of Jeffrey Epstein are described, with abuse occurring from approximately 2002 to 2012.
One victim (Client 1) was abused in New York and Palm Beach, including at Epstein's office while he was sleeping in jail, and was trafficked to 6-7 other men.
The other victim (Client 2) was abused in New York, Palm Beach, and Sao Paulo, Brazil, and was trafficked to at least two other men.
The correspondence discusses scheduling victim interviews for the investigation, with consideration given to the timing of a superseding indictment ('the superseder').
The email chain involves attorneys Mariann Wang and Gloria Allred, indicating legal coordination on behalf of Epstein victims.
